1_2_key_facts_at_a_glance.instruction: This section is intentionally locked and must not be modified by AI.

2_1_company_description.instruction: Describe what the company does using factual language from the document.
extracted: The document describes a standardized customer onboarding and service delivery process for Acme customers, including contract initiation, technical onboarding, enablement, and go-live support for enterprise and SMB customers.
Acme Corp provides onboarding and service delivery for enterprise and SMB customers.
Mobile Productivity Platform.
An all-in-one, mobile-first workspace combining tasks & lightweight project management, docs & structured knowledge, async video & voice updates, and embedded AI summarization and prioritization.
Universal Loyalty Platform

Acme replaces physical loyalty cards with a single universal QR-based mobile wallet. Merchants access an AI-driven analytics dashboard for customer insights, segmentation, and campaigns. Deployment in <1 day with no additional hardware required.

Acme Corp is a mobile-first productivity software company serving small and mid-sized businesses (SMBs). The company focuses on enabling high-velocity teamwork through an integrated mobile workspace combining tasks, documents, asynchronous communication, and AI-assisted prioritization.

evidence.quote: Define standardized onboarding and service delivery for Acme enterprise and SMB customers.
Define standardized onboarding and service delivery for Acme enterprise and SMB customers.
Acme replaces physical loyalty cards with a single universal QR-based mobile wallet.
Merchants access an AI-driven analytics dashboard for customer insights, segmentation, and campaigns.
Deployment in <1 day with no additional hardware required.

Acme Corp is a mobile-first productivity software company serving small and mid-sized businesses
(SMBs).

The company focuses on enabling high-velocity teamwork through an integrated mobile
workspace combining tasks, documents, asynchronous communication, and AI-assisted
prioritization.

2_2_problem_statement.instruction: Extract the problem the company claims to address, only if explicitly described.
extracted: The document states that knowledge workers use multiple tools daily and incur time costs from context switching; mobile-first teams lack reliable workflows, offline access, and governance; and SMBs adopt tools bottom-up but struggle to scale them securely.

Consumers manage dozens of physical and digital loyalty cards, creating friction at checkout. Merchants lack real-time visibility into customer behavior and campaign performance. Existing loyalty systems are fragmented, costly, and slow to deploy for SMB retailers.

evidence.quote: Context switching costs ~23 minutes per interruption.
Mobile-first teams lack reliable workflows, offline access, and governance on the go.
SMBs adopt tools bottom-up but fail to scale them securely.
Consumers manage dozens of physical and digital loyalty cards, creating friction at checkout.
Merchants lack real-time visibility into customer behavior and campaign performance.
Existing loyalty systems are fragmented, costly, and slow to deploy for SMB retailers.

extracted: High-velocity teamwork for SMBs.

Current functionality described: an all-in-one, mobile-first workspace combining tasks & lightweight project management, docs & structured knowledge, async video & voice updates, and embedded AI summarization and prioritization.

Current functionality described: replaces physical loyalty cards with a single universal QR-based mobile wallet; provides merchants an AI-driven analytics dashboard for customer insights, segmentation, and campaigns; deployment in <1 day with no additional hardware required.
Current solution is an integrated mobile workspace combining tasks, documents, asynchronous communication, and AI-assisted prioritization.

3_1_market_overview.instruction: Extract descriptions of market context or regulatory environment if explicitly stated.
extracted: The document references a GDPR-related regulatory context.
Market opportunity context is described with TAM/SAM/SOM sizing for SMB collaboration & productivity software, including tailwinds.

Market context includes increased hybrid and field-based work among SMB knowledge workers, rising adoption of asynchronous collaboration, SMB consolidation of SaaS tools, acceleration of AI adoption in productivity software, and EU emphasis on GDPR-aligned/privacy-conscious vendors.

Market opportunity sizing and tailwinds: EU Retail Loyalty Software TAM is stated as €18B; serviceable market in Nordics & DACH is stated as €1.2B; tailwinds include cashless payments, mobile wallets, and data-driven retail marketing.
The document states GDPR compliance across products and internal processes.

evidence.quote: TAM: €12.5B — Global SMB collaboration & productivity software
SAM: €3.1B — Mobile-first and hybrid-work SMBs in EU & North America
Tailwinds: BYOD, async-first work, AI copilots, SMB SaaS consolidation.

Shift to mobile-first workflows as hybrid and field-based work increases among SMB knowledge
workers.
Rising adoption of asynchronous collaboration models reducing reliance on meetings.
SMB-driven consolidation of SaaS tools to reduce cost and operational complexity.
Acceleration of AI adoption in productivity software, particularly summarization and prioritization.
Increased emphasis on GDPR-aligned and privacy-conscious software vendors in the EU market.
Tailwinds: cashless payments, mobile wallets, data-driven retail marketing.

General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) compliance implemented across all products and
internal processes.

3_3_customer_acquisition_and_sales_motio.instruction: Extract sales model, go-to-market approach, and sales cycle details if documented.
extracted: Go-to-market is described as bottom-up adoption via a free tier, followed by sales-assisted expansion and then enterprise contracts. Primary channels are content, app marketplaces, and founder-led sales.
Bottom-up purchasing behavior with team-level entry and expansion-driven growth.

Go-to-market roles include a Sales Lead responsible for pipeline development, enterprise pilots, and expansion deals; a Customer Success Manager for onboarding, retention, and account expansion; and a Marketing Manager for demand generation, content, and product marketing.

evidence.quote: ClickUp — Broad feature coverage with limited mobile-first design.
Monday.com — Strong workflow tooling with desktop-centric usage patterns.
Notion — Knowledge-centric platform with limited execution workflows.
Slack — Communication-focused tool lacking integrated task and document execution.
Asana — Project management-oriented with limited async media support.

extracted: Differentiation statements include that customer data is not used for model training by default, on-device AI processing for sensitive workflows, and separation of customer environments.
Acme differentiation: designed mobile-first (not desktop-adapted); offline sync and low-bandwidth reliability; on-device AI for privacy-sensitive customers; fast SMB deployment velocity.

Stated competitive positioning includes mobile-first UX, offline/low-bandwidth operation, integrated async video and voice updates, on-device AI processing for privacy/compliance, and fast deployment/low operational overhead for SMB customers.
Stated differentiation includes deployment speed and no hardware requirement.

4_3_technology_stack_and_architecture.instruction: List technologies, platforms, and architecture components explicitly referenced.
extracted: Referenced technical components include SSO and "in-app" guided setup.

Referenced architecture/technology components include encryption in transit and at rest, separation of customer environments, role-based access control (RBAC), multi-factor authentication for admins, audit logging of privileged actions, and on-device AI processing for sensitive workflows.
On-device AI processing is referenced.
Mobile architectures; scalable backend systems; cloud infrastructure; core APIs; data services.

Primary data residency is on AWS eu-west-1 (Ireland). Encryption uses AES-256 for data at rest and TLS 1.2+ for data in transit. Access control includes RBAC with SSO via Google Workspace. Backups are daily encrypted with 30-day retention. Automated vulnerability scanning is monthly and high-severity vulnerabilities are patched within 7 days.
